name: n-hexyl acetate
Reason: 1,3-dioxolane has a melting point of -106.0 degrees Celsius. The introduction of the hexyl group increases the molecular weight and van der Waals interactions, with an approximate increase of +20 degrees Celsius per group, totaling +120 degrees Celsius. The acetate group introduces a carbonyl functional group, which raises the melting point due to the presence of a polar functional group. The carbonyl group introduces a dipole, increasing intermolecular forces and melting point by approximately +40 degrees Celsius.
